title: Fix `x.py clippy` to be less janky

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: E-medium
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Medium / intermediate

body:
I hacked this together when I implemented it originally (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77351) and it breaks quite frequently because it uses the host toolchain instead of being managed by bootstrap.

I think ideally the fix would look something like:
- Download clippy for the bootstrap toolchain in `bootstrap.py` (look for `add_component`)
- Remove all this hacky code running rustc --version; treat it just the same as --cfg=bootstrap for `build` and `check`.
- Either put a `todo!()` for stages other than 0, or build `tool::Clippy` in-tree before running them, rather than the host clippy.

_Originally posted by @jyn514 in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/95766#discussion_r845159871_
